storage/persistent.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * @file storage/persistent.h
00003  *
00004  * Interface to read/write/erase operations on a persistent storage device.
00005  *
00006  * The prototypes contained in this file can be implemented multiple times to be
00007  * adapted to different storage devices such as Hard Disk Drives, Flash memory
00008  * devices or RAMs (i.e. for development and testing purposes).
00009  */
00010 
00011 
00012 #pragma once
00013 
00014 
00015 /**
00016  * Reads some data from the permanent storage handler compiled with this
00017  * function.
00018  *
00019  * @todo  Define the possible error numbers and their respective meaning.
00020  *
00021  * @param[out] buffer   The pointer to a char buffer where the read data has to
00022  *                      be written.
00023  * @param[in]  address  The address from which to start to read from the storage
00024  *                      device.
00025  * @param[in]  length   The number of bytes to read from the storage device,
00026  *                      starting at the given address.
00027  *
00028  * @return  The number of bytes read, a negative number if an error occurred.
00029  */
00030 int pstorage_read(char * buffer, void * address, int length);
00031 
00032 
00033 /**
00034  * Writes some data to the permanent storage handler compiled with this
00035  * function.
00036  *
00037  * @todo  Define the possible error numbers and their respective meaning.
00038  *
00039  * @param[out] buffer   The pointer to a char buffer from where the data to
00040  *                      write has to be read.
00041  * @param[in]  address  The address from which to start to write to the storage
00042  *                      device.
00043  * @param[in]  length   The number of bytes to write to the storage device,
00044  *                      starting at the given address.
00045  *
00046  * @return  The number of bytes written, a negative number if an error occurred.
00047  */
00048 int pstorage_write(const char * buffer, void * address, int length);
00049 
00050 
00051 /**
00052  * Deletes some data from the permanent storage handler compiled with this
00053  * function.
00054  *
00055  * @todo  Define the possible error numbers and their respective meaning.
00056  *
00057  * @param[in]  address  The address from which to start to delete the data from
00058  *                      the storage device.
00059  * @param[in]  length   The number of bytes to delete from the storage device,
00060  *                      starting at the given address.
00061  *
00062  * @return  The number of bytes deleted, a negative number if an error occurred.
00063  */
00064 int pstorage_erase(void * address, int length);
